I think it flies using some form of Evil Magiks. Basically the rover wheels get it up to about 16 m/s on the runway and then you aim for the runways drop off, from there the game's infinite glide bug takes over and your airborne.

It's really too heavy and I just threw it together. The engines may just be decorative and it's the glide bug that is making it fly. The wheels break often on takeoff at 16 m/s and I don't think you can land it without breaking them.

It's barely flyable, I land it by going in nose down into the dirt and hope the roll cage lives up to its name.

I thought about it, I really did, but decided it was a terrible joke

Those are doable, the problem is the wheels have to be symmetrical front to back, because symmetry just rotates it around, otherwise you would have to make a left and right version separately. I learn this the hard way after lots of facepalming.

Also the suspensions are kind of "fake", the wheels just go up and down and not in a circular fashion like a real suspension with 4 bar linkages. So it may look a bit off when you have lots of travel.
